c1.q: What are 86% of consumers willing to do for a better service experience?
c1.a: Pay more! Studies show 86% of consumers pay more for a better service experience.

c2.q: What is the role of Customer Service beyond solving problems?
c2.a: CS represents the COMPANY'S VOICE in direct contact with the customer. It's a strategic area, essential to preserve values, reputation and brand credibility.

c3.q: What does the customer usually expect when contacting CS?
c3.a: To be heard with attention and empathy, receive quick and efficient service, feel the company cares, have clarity about next steps and leave satisfied.

c4.q: What are the Multichannel Service channels?
c4.a: Phone, email, chat and electronic means.

c6.q: What actions are performed in Outbound Service?
c6.a: Card activation, registration updates, promotion communication and cancellation reversal.

c1.q: What is the main source of store information?
c1.a: The company Intranet! It's the main work tool for quick and accurate queries.

c2.q: What is the Intranet path to look up store data?
c2.a: Intranet ‚Üí Branches ‚Üí Registration data and schedules.

c3.q: What information can be found in the Intranet Branches section?
c3.a: Store addresses, opening hours and contact methods.

c4.q: What are the benefits of mastering Intranet queries?
c4.a: Service agility, more assertive responses, information standardization and better customer experience.

c5.q: Where can customers check offers and promotions?
c5.a: In flyers (physical and digital), on the official company website and on the offers WhatsApp.

c6.q: How does the offers WhatsApp sequence work?
c6.a: 1) Select the store of interest, 2) Access the community via link or QR Code, 3) Receive personalized offers on phone.

c1.q: What is CDC and what is its law?
c1.a: It's the Consumer Protection Code, Law No. 8,078/90, created to protect consumers and ensure fair and balanced consumption relations.

c2.q: Why is knowing CDC important for Customer Service?
c2.a: To respond with confidence, avoid rework and convey credibility to the customer.

c3.q: Does CDC require exchange of products without defect at physical store?
c3.a: NO! Exchange of products without defect at physical store is a COMMERCIAL POLICY (company courtesy), not a legal right.

c4.q: What is the Right of Withdrawal and when does it apply?
c4.a: It's the right to cancel a purchase within 7 CALENDAR DAYS after receipt. It only applies to ONLINE purchases or outside commercial establishment.

c5.q: How many days does the supplier have to fix defect via technical assistance?
c5.a: Up to 30 DAYS to fix the defect.

c6.q: If defect isn't fixed in 30 days, what options does customer have?
c6.a: Exchange product for equal or similar, proportional discount on amount paid, or full refund of amount paid.

c7.q: What is the deadline to complain about defects in durable products?

c8.q: How to handle food product complaints?
c8.a: Customer brings product + receipt to store. Evaluation by management. Correct filling of Reason, Brand and Batch is essential.

c9.q: Why can't perishable products be exchanged after wrong purchase?
c9.a: Because once removed from store they can't be reconditioned due to food safety issues (temperature risk).

c10.q: What is the procedure for defective Appliances?
c10.a: Must be sent to brand's technical assistance. If after 30 days there's no solution, company exchanges with service order.
